NEW: PGCE in MFL : URDU FOR SEPTEMBER 2007

The College is including Urdu in the range   of languages offered in its PGCE programme(for 14-19 age range) for September 2007. There are only 10 places available.   Students should apply to Trinity &amp
column2: All Saints via the GTTR immediately as there will be competition for these limited places. Applicants should have an honours degree and either have studied Urdu as part of their degree or be a native speaker of Urdu. For more information please contact Anne Welburn on a.welburn@leedstrinity.ac.uk or phone 0113 2837268.

column1: The course will equip you with the
knowledge, understanding and practical skills required to
pursue a successful career in teaching. You will develop
your skills in planning, delivering and assessing lessons
You should also be able to contribute effectively to the
cross-curricular provision of your school. You will learn
to cater for the variety of intellectual, social and moral
needs of pupils in schools and will become aware of the
changing nature of teaching in a complex, multicultural
